exec: pm.test("OAuth Client includes the SCIM API role with API Access", function ()
// we are not authorised, so our accesstoken  must be invalid. We shall get a new one
// A 401 error might be because something is wrong with the call or even the SAP SAC SCIM API, so we need to start counting errors,
// so we don't end up in an endless loop.
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Fetching a new tenant access token');
pm.execution.setNextRequest("GET tenantaccesstoken"); // once a new accesstoken is successfully returned this call will be repeated thanks to the 'recovery' variable set in the pre-request
// Need to set the ContinuousErrors count to 0 as we got a valid response from the API
console.error("Please use sample script 731 to reset the inconsistent status");
let   ThisOAuthClient=oauthClients.find( OAuthClient => OAuthClient.name === pm.variables.get("Embedded_OAuthClientName"));  // returns the OAuthClent currently named by this Postman Environment

let   ThisOAuthClient_has_required_settings= ( ThisOAuthClient && ThisOAuthClient.apiRoles.includes("PROFILE:sap.epm:SCIM_Public_API") && ThisOAuthClient.apiAccessEnabled ); // checks if the Postman enviromment has the right settings, or not.
// if the OAuth client (as named in this Postman environment) either does NOT exist, or does not have the right settings...
// ... then we shall search for all OAuthClients defined in the SAP Analytics Cloud Service for one.
// if we find a valid OAuth client we shall use that as the basis to define Postman environments to use.
// A valud OAuthClient has been identified
console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SAMLSSO setting assigned to this Postman environment: '+pm.environment.get("SAMLSSO"));

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': TimeZoneHours         : Undefined! Variable set as \'0\' for you. Please update the environment variable TimeZoneHours to be a number between -23 and 23');

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': TimeZoneMinutes       : Undefined! Variable set as \'0\' for you. Please update the environment variable TimeZoneMinutes to be -30, 0 or 30');

console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': TimeZoneDescription   : Undefined! Variable set as \'UTC\' for you. Please update the environment variable TimeZoneDescription to be the description of your timezone');

const preferredlanguage                 =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_preferredlanguage");  // possible values: 'ar', 'bg', 'zh-CN', 'zh-TW', 'hr', 'ca', 'cs', 'cy', 'nl', 'da', 'en', 'en-GB', 'fi', 'fr', 'fr-CA', 'de', 'de-CH', 'el', 'he', 'hi', 'hu', 'id', 'it', 'ja', 'ko', 'ms', 'no', 'pl', 'pt', 'pt-PT', 'ro', 'ru', 'sh', 'sk', 'sl', 'es', 'es-MX', 'sv', 'th', 'tr', 'uk', 'vi', 'en-US-sappsd' and possibly more will be added over time!
const active                            =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_active"); // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'

const dataaccesslanguage                =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dataaccesslanguage"); // possible values: 'zz' (default), 'af', 'ar', 'bg',  ... many more as shown above in preferredlanguage.
const dateformatting                    =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dateformatting");     // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!
const timeformatting                    =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_timeformatting");     // possible values include: 'H:mm:ss' (24H), 'h:mm:ss A' (12H)
const systemnotificationsemailoptin     =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_systemnotificationsemailoptin"); // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
const marketingemailoptin               =pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_marketingemailoptin");                    // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
console.log(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': New users will be created with the following values for their respective properties:');

pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_preferredlanguage", "en");    // possible values: 'ar', 'bg', 'zh-CN', 'zh-TW', 'hr', 'ca', 'cs', 'cy', 'nl', 'da', 'en', 'en-GB', 'fi', 'fr', 'fr-CA', 'de', 'de-CH', 'el', 'he', 'hi', 'hu', 'id', 'it', 'ja', 'ko', 'ms', 'no', 'pl', 'pt', 'pt-PT', 'ro', 'ru', 'sh', 'sk', 'sl', 'es', 'es-MX', 'sv', 'th', 'tr', 'uk', 'vi', 'en-US-sappsd' and possibly more will be added over time!

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_preferredlanguage                        : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_preferredlanguage")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_active", "true");    // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_active                                   : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_active")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dataaccesslanguage", "en");    // possible values: 'zz' (default), 'af', 'ar', 'bg',  ... many more as shown above in preferredlanguage.

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_dataaccesslanguage                       : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dataaccesslanguage")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dateformatting", "MMM d, yyyy");    // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_dateformatting                           : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_dateformatting")+'\'');

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_timeformatting                           : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_timeformatting")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_numberformatting", "1,234.56");    // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_numberformatting                         : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_numberformatting")+'\'');
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_cleanupnotificationsnumberofdays", "0");    // possible values include: 'MMM d, yyyy', 'dd/MM/yyyy', 'MM.dd.yyyy', ... many more!
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_systemnotificationsemailoptin", "true");    // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'
pm.environment.set("SCIM_NewUserDefault_marketingemailoptin", "false");    // possible values: 'true' or 'false' are valid, unlike 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': SCIM_NewUserDefault_marketingemailoptin                      : Undefined! Variable set as \''+ pm.environment.get("SCIM_NewUserDefault_marketingemailoptin")+'\'');

console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': This Postman Environment has been updated (SACserviceFQDN, SACtokenFQDN, ContentNamespace, Embedded_OAuthClientName, Username, Password, SAMLSSO). You are now ready to use the other sample scripts that create users and teams etc.');
console.info(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Run sample script \'001-Test-Es-Tests Single Environment Setup\' to validate the SCIM API is working correctly');

console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': This Postman Environment has only partly been updated (SACserviceFQDN, SACtokenFQDN, ContentNamespace). You will not be able to run other sample scripts to create users and teams etc.');
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': No valid OAuth Client exists. Unable to fully update this Postman Environment! Create a new OAuth Client with sample script 721 or 741');
// we got an unexpected response from the SAC API
if (!errors) { errors=0 };  // in case errors has not yet been set we need to set it to 0

const maxerrors=parseInt( (pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")!=undefined) ? parseInt(pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")) : 3 );  // maxerrors should be at least 2 to allow for recovery of invalid access token and csrf tokens
// it means a setting of 1 would mean any call following would not be allowed to re-attempt the call.
// a setting of 3 is recommended to allow at least 1 re-attempted call and any subsequent call also failing for a potentially different reason
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Too many continuous errors. Aborting. Response: '+ responseBody);
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Continuous errors detected. Response: '+ responseBody);
else  // we are on a Cloud Foundary Platform
pm.environment.set("tenantaccesstoken", jsonData.access_token);  // setting the tenantaccesstoken so its re-used for all subsequent requests
pm.execution.setNextRequest(pm.variables.get("recovery"));      // we will now return to the request that sent us here in the first place
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Invalid Embedded_uua_clientid or Embedded_uua_clientsecret: '+ responseBody);
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Unhandled error. Response Body: '+ responseBody);
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Already attempted to get a valid request. Will now quit');
console.warn(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Will make one more attempt to get a new accesstoken');

const maxerrors=parseInt( (pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")!=undefined) ? parseInt(pm.environment.get("abort_after_continous_errors_reaches")) : 3 );  // maxerrors needs to be at least 2, otherwise valid workflows may be able to correctly recover from an invalid access tokens or invalid csrf-tokens
console.error(pm.info.requestName+' '+pm.info.eventName+': Too many continuous errors. Aborting');
// a valid accesstoken may have been obtained, but the request where it came from could have failed, hence the need to trap for a continous loop of errors here
